default.title: Sports Teams by Age Groups
default.description:
This dataset provides a breakdown of the number of registered sports teams in Qatar by age group. The age groups include Adults, Youth, Junior Under-18, Junior Under-16, and Kids. Each row represents a calendar year and the number of teams registered under each age category.

The dataset helps monitor participation trends among different age segments and supports strategic planning for youth sports development, resource allocation, and long-term athletic talent nurturing across the country.

fields.name: year
fields.description: The calendar year in which the data was recorded
fields.label: Year

fields.label: License Type

fields.description: Total number of industrial firms operating under the specified license type
fields.label: No. of Firms

fields.name: investment_qar_mil
fields.description: The value of investment in Qatari Riyals (in millions) in the beverage manufacturing sector
fields.label: Investment QAR (Mil)

fields.name: no_of_labour
fields.description: Total number of laborers working in beverage manufacturing under the license type
fields.label: No. of Labour

default.title: Manufacture of Beverages
default.description:
This dataset presents annual statistics on the manufacture of beverages sector in the State of Qatar. It is structured by year and type of license (Industrial Registration or Industrial License), with key indicators including the number of firms, investment volume in Qatari Riyals (millions), and the number of laborers involved in the sector.

The data supports insights into the industrial growth, investment trends, and employment capacity of the beverage manufacturing industry. It is valuable for economic analysis, investment planning, and industrial development monitoring.

fields.label: Junior Under 16

fields.name: kids
fields.description: Number of GCC-level championships in the kids age group
fields.label: Kids

default.title: GCC Championships by Sports Activity and Age Groups (2021-2022)
default.description: This dataset provides information on the participation in the GCC Championships across various sports activities, segmented by different age groups. The dataset includes activities such as football, athletics, basketball, swimming, and others, organized by age categories such as Adults, Youth, Junior Under 18, Junior Under 16, and Kids. The data is structured to highlight the participation count for each sport within each age group. This dataset supports analysis of youth and adult participation in sports, helping to track trends in the development of sports at various levels.

default.title: Number of New Students on Scholarships Abroad by Field of Study, Scientific Degree, and Gender
default.description: This dataset provides statistics on the number of new students who enrolled in scholarships abroad, categorized by field of study, scientific degree, and gender. It enables the analysis of academic trends and gender distribution across different fields and qualification levels.

default.description: This dataset presents the number, gross tonnage, and net tonnage of vessels arriving at Al-Ruwais Port in Qatar by vessel type and country of registration for the year 2023.

fields.description: نوع/فئة النفايات أو الخردة المصدّرة (مثل: البلاستيك، المطاط، المعادن الخردة، إلخ)

fields.label: Weight (KG)

fields.name: value_qar
fields.description: Export value of the waste or scrap material in Qatari Riyals
fields.label: Value (QAR)

default.title: Waste and Scrap Exports by Type and Year
default.description: This dataset presents annual export figures for various types of waste and scrap from Qatar, including electronic waste, plastic, rubber, paper, scrap metal, and others (e.g., oil and glass waste). Each entry includes the export weight (in kilograms) and value (in Qatari Riyals). Missing values are indicated with ellipses.

default.title: Referees’ Training Courses by Sports Activity and Implementation Level (2023)
default.description: This dataset provides statistics on the number of referees’ training courses conducted in 2023, categorized by sports federation and implementation level (Domestic, Gulf, Arab, Asian, and International). The table supports insights into the scope and intensity of training programs across different sports disciplines in Qatar. This data helps in evaluating sports development efforts and referee capacity building.
